attributes.trait_type: grated cheese (e.g., Gruyère, Emmental, or Cheddar)

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Dough:

Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder.
Cut in the cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in the grated cheese and sour cream until the dough comes together.

Shape the Biscuits:

Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to about 1/2-inch thickness.

Cut out rounds using a biscuit cutter or a glass.
Place the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake:

Brush the tops of the biscuits with the beaten egg.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.

Serve:

Serve warm or at room temperature.
